name: Excel 2016 Advanced
subtitle: Spreadsheet application
description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.
descriptionMD: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to excel to the next level of skills.

episodes.title: Sort and Filter
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate using the Sort and Filter functions in Excel 2016. Using Sort will allow you to more easily find specific data based on a given criteria. Using Filter will give you even more granular searching functionality by adding drop-downs, colors, and custom filters.

episodes.title: Conditional Formatting
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore using Conditional Formatting to allows you to apply formats to a cell or range of cells, and have that formatting change depending on the value of the cell or the value of a formula.

episodes.title: Outline and Subtotals
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using Outline and Subtotals in Excel 2016. Here you will learn how to work with Outlines to create collapsable groups of rows and columns to show/hide your data as well as add Subtotal lines to applicable ranges.

episodes.title: Tables
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with Tables in Excel 2016. Here they will cover Table basics like colors, boundaries, and row/column add or delete, total row worksheets, removing duplicates, and convert to range.

episodes.title: Data Tables
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover Data tables, the 'What If' analysis, showing formula for cost, F5=B12, selecting table range, array function, changing values, table set up with increments, and review data validation.

episodes.title: Consolidate Data
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss combining data, Consolidate.xlsx, copy headings, selecting first cell to place results, Data tab -> Consolidate, function list, select range, New Workbook, and updates in consolidation.

episodes.title: Scenarios
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach talk about what a 'Scenario' is in Excel 2016 advanced, the 'What If Analysis' feature, using scenarios, using named ranges/cells for reference, how to create 'name' from selection, always have a 'current,' hide and lock/document security, and summary & pivot tables.

episodes.title: Goal Seek
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover what Goal Seek is, how to use it, backward engineering a result, using a formula, need to use cell that links to the result, and Data Tables as an option.

episodes.title: Remove Duplicates
episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss the Remove Duplicate Command, conditional formatting, advanced filter with unique records checkbox, remove duplicate command sheet, making sure to copy sheet before direct remove, ADV Filter Unique Sheet, and deleting rows.

episodes.title: Create an Invitation
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne culminate our graphical element skills in Excel 2016 by creating a birthday invitation. Here you will see how to use page layouts, orientation, formatting text, moving cells, inserting images, grouping images, etc. Then they show you how to create a two-sided invitation, printing, marking paper for orientation, and adjusting element placement for printer adjustment.

episodes.title: Image: Basics
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to add a graphical element to your Excel 2016 spreadsheets. Here they will demonstrate inserting graphics from a file or online, as well as resizing, rotating, aligning, moving, and cropping your images.

episodes.title: Images: Format
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive deeper into working with graphics inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to manipulate images by adding boarders, effects, change picture styles, reset pictures, perform corrections, add artistic effects, add alternate text, and titles/descriptions.

episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne look at adding and/or formatting Shapes in Excel 2016. Here they will explore what Shapes are inside Excel and then move into manipulating them by resizing, rotating, filling with gradients/colors, connecting them with lines, adding text to them, and editing their points.

episodes.title: Shapes: Multiple Shapes and Icons
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue working with Shapes in Excel 2016, this time working with multiple shapes as well as icons. Here you will see how to duplicate, select multiple, rotate, align, change stack order, group/ungroup, and use the selection pane for Shapes.

episodes.title: Smart Art
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using Smart Art in Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to use Smart Art to more easily add a graphical element to your spreadsheets by giving you self-adjusting themes, text, and shapes.

episodes.title: Shared Workbooks
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore shared workbooks in Excel 2016. Here they cover the why and how of sharing Workbooks as well as showing you what to expect when working with shared Workbooks. They also look at sharing through OneDrive for online collaboration.

episodes.title: Track Changes
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into tracking changes in Excel 2016. Here they will explain why you would want to enable tracking and how to accomplish that. They also take you through the tracking experience to help you understand how this may benefit you in your environment.

episodes.title: Data Validation
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore implementing Data Validation inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to prevent erroneous data types from being entered by restricting the type of data that a user can insert. They also show you how to create custom error messages, highlighting invalid data, and password protecting.

episodes.title: Workbook Security
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into Workbook Security in Excel 2016. Here they will show you security features like protecting Workbooks, protecting Worksheets, Range editing, Mark as Final, Encrypt with Password, restricting access, and Digital Signatures.

episodes.title: Document Properties
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with the Document Properties of an Excel 2016 Worksheet. Here they will go over the different properties and metadata that is attached to a given Workbook/Worksheet. This includes data like the who is the author of the document, when was it last modified, and other Advanced properties.

episodes.title: Customize Interface
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how you can customize the Excel 2016 interface to make it more efficient for the end user. Here you will see how to customize things like the Ribbon, make custom keyboard shortcuts, and other options in Excel that can be manipulated for ease of use.
